Package localization

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    LightLocalization
    LightLocaliztion uses one light sensor to detect lines around the robot and ultimately precisely travel to a given coordinate.
    LocalizationLab
    LocalizationLab uses a system to localize the robot using the ultrasonic sensor and the light sensor the robot moves and it calculates its position.
    Navigation
    Navigation uses simple trigonometry along with information obtained from the odometer to be able to allow the robot to travel to certain x and y coordinates, or turn a specified number of degrees
    Odometer
    Odometer uses the number of wheel rotations the robot has completed, along with some simple trigonometry to determine the robot's x, y, and theta coordinates.
    Resources
    Resources allows us to keep all the interfaces to our external hardware components in one place
    UltrasonicLocalizer
    UltrasonicLocalizer uses an ultrasonic sensor to detect walls surrounding the robot which ultimately allows the robot to localize itself to theta = 0
